Hi {!Contact.FirstName},
Hope that you have seen and signed up for the Big Sleepout. Here are a few more, slightly different opportunities for you... Stand up be Heard
Do you want to have your voice heard? Do you want to be part of a creative journey? Do you want to Speak to the people who have the power make change? Do you want to be part of a one of a kind creative project?
Creative Anarchy Theatre in partnership with The Challenge is looking for you! Stand Up Be Heard is a project which ends with a performance to an audience of local decision makers, including MPs, Council members and Community leaders.
You will have the opportunity to learn and improve key skills such as communication, debating and teamwork as well as many more to boost your C.V. You will also receive a letter of recommendation/reference, project certificate and DVD of the project.
Be part of the first project of its kind!
Stand Up Be Heard is your opportunity to have your voice heard by the people who can make change!
Be part of it! Sign up HERE
Southside Producers are a collective of young people from Birmingham - passionate about the arts in the city - together we are hosting ‪YAY16‬ on the 19th February 2016 at The Old Rep Theatre.
YAY16 is a collaborative event to launch the Year of Arts and Young People 2016 in partnership with:
Birmingham City Council // The Old Rep Theatre // Beatfreeks // MAIA Creatives
& YOU!
For more info go to https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/yay16-tickets-21205807140
Along with The Gap Arts Project volunteers, fundraisers, artists and activists will be based at Centrala Venues in Digbeth for the duration of 11th -17th of April where GAP will be holding an ongoing exhibition as well as various workshops, film screenings, talks/discussions, poetry & spoken word performances, live music, communal meals, and short theatre performances.
GAP will be raising funds and awareness to support migrants living in or attempting to enter the UK.
If you are interested please either contact marthadavis@headweb.co.uk or visithttp://www.thegapartsproject.co.uk
